passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Quidditch is a fictional sport in the Harry Potter series. • The sport involves flying on broomsticks and scoring points by passing balls through hoops. • Quidditch has become a real-life sport played at universities worldwide. • Muggle Quidditch, a ground-based version, was created in 2005 by students at Middlebury College.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to explain how Quidditch has transitioned from fiction to reality?

choices.A: Quidditch is a sport in the Harry Potter series that involves broomsticks and hoops.
choices.B: Originally a fictional sport in the Harry Potter series, Quidditch has become a real-life sport played at universities with its ground-based version, Muggle Quidditch.
choices.C: Muggle Quidditch is a ground-based version of the sport played at universities worldwide.
choices.D: Quidditch was first played in 2005 at Middlebury College as Muggle Quidditch.

explanation: B: 'Originally a fictional sport in the Harry Potter series, Quidditch has become a real-life sport played at universities with its ground-based version, Muggle Quidditch.' is the correct answer because it effectively explains the transition of Quidditch from a fictional sport to a real-life sport played at universities.
distractor_explanation: 'Quidditch is a sport in the Harry Potter series that involves broomsticks and hoops.' is incorrect because it only describes the fictional sport without explaining its transition to reality.
'Muggle Quidditch is a ground-based version of the sport played at universities worldwide.' is incorrect because it only mentions the real-life version without linking it to the fictional sport.
'Quidditch was first played in 2005 at Middlebury College as Muggle Quidditch.' is incorrect because it does not effectively connect the fictional and real-life versions of the sport.
